definition:
A real function $f$ on a real interval $I$ is said to be *matrix
monotone of $n$*, if\
$$A \leq_L B  \Rightarrow f(A) \leq f(B)$$ for all Hermitian
$n \times n$ matrices $A, B$ with spectra contained in $I$. Here
$\leq_L$ denotes the Loewner order, and the notation $f(A)$ is explained
in the entry functional calculus for Hermitian matrices.
